intro: Matelea decipiens, commonly known as the "false hibiscus," is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red, with five petals. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a velvety texture. Matelea decipiens is often found in woodland areas and thrives in partial shade with well-drained soil.
